    • Method Detail

      • Basic1

        public void Basic1(java.util.List<Item> result)
        This is a UI implementation function for Basic Task 1.

        It sets the value of labelCount, labelPrice, labelMin and labelLatest.

        It sets the URI events on labelMin and labelLatest.

        The test case is excluded.

        Its logic implementation functions are summeryFill(), summeryClickMin() and summeryClickLatest().

        Returns:

        void since it is a UI implementation function, it has no return variable.

        Parameters:
        result - a list of all items scrapped by the WebScrapper.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - Price of some items are negative may result in undefined behavior in logic function summeryFill(), summeryClickMin() and summeryClickLatest().
        java.lang.NullPointerException - the length of item.getTime() being not equal to 7 will result in undefined behavior in logic function summeryFill(), summeryClickMin() and summeryClickLatest().

      • Advance1

        public void Advance1(java.util.List<Item> result,
                     java.lang.String searchName)
        This is a UI implementation function for Advance Task 1.

        It sets the values of barChart.

        It sets the color of the double clicked bars to be blue. Initialize and restore the rest of bars to be orange.

        The test case is excluded.

        Its logic implementation functions are barChartFill() and barChartClick().

        Returns:

        void since it is a UI implementation function, it has no return variable.

        Parameters:
        result - a List of all items scrapped by the WebScrapper.
        searchName - a String of the search keyword, to display on the legend.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - Price of some items are negative may result in undefined behavior in logic function barChartFill() and barChartClick().
        java.lang.NullPointerException - the length of item.getTime() being not equal to 7 will result in undefined behavior in logic function barChartFill() and barChartClick().

      • summeryFill

        public java.lang.String[] summeryFill(java.util.List<Item> result)
        This is a logic implementation function for Basic Task 1.

        During each search, it calculates the values of labelCount, labelPrice, labelMin, labelLatest, lowestPriceURI, latestPostURI, highestPrice.

        If the result is not found, the Average selling price, Lowest selling price and Latest post will be displayed as "-".

        If the items scrapped of price 0, these items are not included in the calculation of Average selling price and Lowest selling price.

        If all the item prices are 0, the Average selling price and Lowest selling price will be "-".

        The test case is testSummeryFill().

        Parameters:
        result - a List of all items scrapped by the WebScrapper.
        Returns:
        a array of string containing the value of labelCount, labelPrice, labelMin, labelLatest, lowestPriceURI, latestPostURI, highestPrice.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - Price of some items are negative may result in undefined behavior.
        java.lang.NullPointerException - the length of item.getTime() being not equal to 7 will result in undefined behavior.

      • summeryClickMin

        public java.lang.String summeryClickMin(java.util.List<Item> result)
        This is a logic implementation function for Basic Task 1.

        During each search, a clickable URL link will be displayed in the field Lowest Selling Price.

        While the user decided to click the displayed URL link, the corresponding windows/browser showing that item will pop up.

        If the result is not found or all the item prices are 0, the URL of Lowest selling price do not pop up windows, since price 0 items are not included in the calculation of Lowest selling price.

        If there exists multiple items that are of the lowest price, only one of URL of the lowest price items will be displayed.

        The test case is testSummeryClickMin().

        Parameters:
        result - a List of all items scrapped by the WebScrapper.
        Returns:
        The URL string of the lowest priced item.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - Price of some items are negative may result in undefined behavior.
        java.lang.NullPointerException - the length of item.getTime() being not equal to 7 will result in undefined behavior.

      • summeryClickLatest

        public java.lang.String summeryClickLatest(java.util.List<Item> result)
        This is a logic implementation function for Basic Task 1.

        During each search, a clickable URL link will be displayed in the field Latest post.

        While the user decided to click the displayed URL link, the corresponding windows/browser showing that item will pop up.

        If the result is not found, the URL of Latest post do not pop up windows.

        If there exists multiple items that are the latest post, only one of URL of the latest post items will be displayed.

        The test case is testSummeryClickLatest().

        Parameters:
        result - a List of all items scrapped by the WebScrapper.
        Returns:
        The URL string of the lowest priced item.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - Price of some items are negative may result in undefined behavior.
        java.lang.NullPointerException - the length of item.getTime() being not equal to 7 will result in undefined behavior.

      • barChartFill

        public javafx.scene.chart.XYChart.Series<java.lang.String,java.lang.Number> barChartFill(java.util.List<Item> result,
                                                                                         java.lang.String SearchName)
        This is a logic implementation function for Advance Task 1.

        During each search, the contents in the distribution tab will be refreshed and displayed according to the scrapped data of the search item.

        The barChart is divided into 10 equal width bins. The range of the bins is determined by the price range of the search product. The first bin contains the lowest price while the last bin contains highest price.

        The barChart has proper X-axis label, Y-axis label, legend which says The selling prize of SEARCH KEYWORD.

        If there is only one non-zero price of the histogram, there is one bar in the chart.

        If the result is not found, the barChart will be empty. There is no legend.

        If the items scrapped of price 0, these items are not included in the bars.

        If all the item prices are 0, the barChart will be empty. But there is still the legend showing the selling price of SEARCH KEYWORD

        The test case is testBarChartFill().

        Parameters:
        result - a List of all items scrapped by the WebScrapper.
        SearchName - a String of the search keyword, to display on the legend.
        Returns:
        a barChart whose x-axis is the string of the highest price range of each bar, and y-axis is the number of items in that bar range i.e. [X axis value - barwidth, X axis value) for bar 0-8 and [X axis value - barwidth, X axis value] for bar 9. If there is only one non-zero price of the histogram, there is one bar in the chart.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - Price of some items are negative may result in undefined behavior.
        java.lang.NullPointerException - the length of item.getTime() being not equal to 7 will result in undefined behavior.

      • barChartClick

        public java.lang.String barChartClick(java.util.List<Item> result,
                                      javafx.scene.chart.XYChart.Data<?,?> i)
        This is a logic implementation function for Advance Task 1.

        During each search, while the user decided to double-click a bar displayed in the barChart, the console screen is cleared and displays those items with the price falling in the double-clicked bar (in the default format).

        If the result is not found or if all the item prices are 0, there are no double-clickable bars.

        The test case is testBarChartClick().

        Parameters:
        result - a List of all items scrapped by the WebScrapper.
        i - a double clicked bar in the barChart.
        Returns:
        a string of informations of those items with the price falling in the double-clicked bar (in the default format) to display in the console.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - Price of some items are negative may result in undefined behavior.
        java.lang.NullPointerException - the length of item.getTime() being not equal to 7 will result in undefined behavior.

      • tableFill

        public javafx.collections.ObservableList<Item> tableFill(java.util.List<Item> result)
        This is implementation function for Basic Task 4 which consists most UI files.

        During each search, it outputs title, price, URL, post date in corresponding position in a table format

        Sort the result in ascending order on user clicking each column, and sort in descending order when user click again.

        All cells in the table not editable.

        Pop up a new windows/browser showing the item when the URL is clicked.

        Refresh the table on another search.

        The test case is testTableFill().

        Parameters:
        result - a List of all items scrapped by the WebScrapper.
        Returns:
        mydata, it is a ObservableList Item for test purpose
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - empty url in string may result in undefined behavior.
        java.lang.NullPointerException - the length of item.getTime() being not equal to 7 will result in undefined behavior.

      • tableFillLogic

        public javafx.collections.ObservableList<Item> tableFillLogic(java.util.List<Item> result)
        This is logic implementation function for Basic Task 4 for test purpose.

        my data contains item which has title, price, URL, post date in corresponding position in a table format

        The test case is testTableFill().

        Parameters:
        result - a List of all items scrapped by the WebScrapper.
        Returns:
        mydata, it is a ObservableList of Item for test purpose
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - empty url in string may result in undefined behavior.
        java.lang.NullPointerException - the length of item.getTime() being not equal to 7 will result in undefined behavior.

      • trendFill

        public void trendFill(java.util.List<Item> result,
                      java.lang.String SearchName)
        This is implementation function for Advance Task 3 which contains most UI parts.

        During each search, We output a line chart that contains 7 points. Each point denotes the average price of the products of the searched keyword those are posted on that day.When no data is available on a day the chart will draw one less point.

        the Search Record combo box displays the keyword of the last five searched keywords.On select any of the search record and update the histogram instantly.

        When double-click on a particular point of the chart, The console screen will be cleared and display those items posted on that day. The point being double-click will change its color and the rest of the points should restore its color to default.

        The test case is testTrendFill().

        This is a void function, so please don't expect a return in javadoc.

        Parameters:
        result - a List of all items scrapped by the WebScrapper.
        SearchName - a String of the search keyword, to display on the legend.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - empty url in string may result in undefined behavior.
        java.lang.NullPointerException - the length of item.getTime() being not equal to 7 will result in undefined behavior since our parser can't read it.

      • trendFillLogic

        public javafx.scene.chart.XYChart.Series<java.lang.String,java.lang.Number> trendFillLogic(java.util.List<Item> result,
                                                                                           java.lang.String SearchName)
        This is a logic implementation function for Advance Task 3.

        This is used for logic test case of advance task3

        We only care about X,Y point of series

        The test case is testTrendFill().

        Parameters:
        result - a List of all items scrapped by the WebScrapper.
        SearchName - a String of the search keyword, to display on the legend.
        Returns:
        series XYChart.Series that has argument String,Number
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - empty url in string may result in undefined behavior.
        java.lang.NullPointerException - empty time string could result in undefined behavior.

      • trendFillLogicHelper

        public void trendFillLogicHelper(java.util.List<Item> result,
                                 double[] a,
                                 java.util.Date[] x,
                                 java.lang.String[] output,
                                 int[] count)
        This is a logic implementation helper function for Advance Task 3 to achieve 100%. Please ignore this useless function.

        We will use try catch to parse the string.

        We will also update array a, x,output and count

        This help function is to help test pass 100% junit test.

        Parameters:
        result - a List of all items scrapped by the WebScrapper.
        a - a double array that stores price
        x - an array stores dates of previous 7 days
        output - a string array to store the text to be outputted to console
        count - an array to show how many items show up in a specific day.

      • LogicSearchName

        public java.lang.String LogicSearchName(java.io.File f)

      • LogicSave

        public void LogicSave(java.io.File fileText,
                      java.lang.String CurrentSearchName,
                      java.util.List<Item> CurrentResult)
        This is a Logic implementation function for Adv Task 2(ii\).

        It will open a file and write the current result and current search name into a "*.sxy" file

        It will save the information in the original order.

        The Saved file can be founded in the base root of this java project. (If Use Eclipse, can use "Refresh" and the file will show in the Package Explorer)

        The saved file can be opened by text editor.

        The test case is testSaveAndLoad().

        Parameters:
        fileText - the destination file which used to store the information.
        CurrentSearchName - the string which is the current searched item name.
        CurrentResult - the vector contains the current searched result.
